meanings.sent1: The loud music from next door gallies me.
meanings.sent2: Please don't gallies your little sister while she's studying.
meanings.sent3: His constant tapping on the desk gallies everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The buzzing mosquito gallies me like a persistent fly.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet's sound gallies my ears like a never-ending drumbeat.

meanings.definition: Gallies (noun): a feeling of annoyance or irritation
meanings.sent1: I can't shake off this gallies after a long day at work.
meanings.sent2: Her face showed clear signs of gallies when he kept interrupting her.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain brought a wave of gallies to the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam caused a collective gallies among the commuters.
meanings.sent5: The persistent itch on my arm became a source of gallies throughout the day.
